reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars perfect gift for kids
reviews.reviewText: my 7 year old nephew loved this. its a great gift for kids. Even adults can play. lots of games, it reminded me my childhood days. I bought 2 more :)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2019
reviews.reviewText: It was able to entertain my 6 year old for about an hour. it does work as advertised and it is nice to have a game that can be played when we don't have internet. It has plenty of games to choose from. On the flip side, there is no instructions on how to play the games and the games on the system are not well known so many of the games we just couldn't figure out how to play. Which makes the kids lose interest very quickly. For the price, it was just ok and served its purpose on our long drive on our family vacation.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2020
reviews.reviewText: Gave this as a gift to our 8yr old g'son and he loves it. Very convenient to take with him and has a good battery life.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars its actually good for gift
reviews.reviewText: i got it for my 4 year old nephew and he love it

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Was very satisfied with this as a gift for my grandson
reviews.reviewText: Was a gift for my grandson just as an extra and he really enjoyed all the different games.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2019
reviews.reviewText: Cant understand where good reviews came from. This item just stops working after 30 seconds of using it. Then you press "reset", it recovers, but after 30 seconds the story repeats, it stops again.There were no screw on the lid, that covers batteries, so your kid can easily get it.There is no "MINI GAME" button in the menu, as it is stated in the User Manual for you to get to those 220 announced games, so as result you have about 20 games.So what we got is exciting wait for two days, and a huge disappointment for your kid and you.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2019
reviews.reviewText: My grandson enjoys playing this game console when we are traveling in my car, it has a lot of games and the battery life is pretty good.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars As an adult, I hate the slow gamespeeds. Kids may be OK with it.
reviews.reviewText: Simply put, as an adult who has gamed most of his life, I hate this thing. Now, for kids the slower pacing may be beneficial as their reaction times need to grow and develope.If you remember free Flash Media games from the late 90s, you will be at home. The game selection is broken down to essentially derivative versions of classic 70s and 80s simple arcade games. There are minor variations of Hang On, Breakout, Space Invaders, there is even a pseudo Bomberman?!?!?, and other simple input "puzzle" games. Then there are aiming (Gallery) games that are either very grindy, or outright broken. There is the old windows version of Free Cell?!?! Very convoluted in how the games are labeled. Some games are D-pad only, and you need to figure that out for yourself.What I really am irked at is:-4 button layout and some games ask for letters which aren't there. And I feel it is actually only a 2-button layout-Slow, slow, slow gameplay.-No instructions for the games.-Some games I cannot even find the interaction for.-The included "fidget wheel" that I just... I don't get it.-Games don't tell you what, or if, the buttons do.-Some games have a well known name like Frogger, and it is not Frogger.-Point and Click games exist here. And that feels very slow as you have to use the D-pad.This indeed does have a place for players who need more time with games. That is the only audience I can see this for. But then there are no instructions on how to play the variety of games, some of which I only know because of my long history with 80s games.I can akmost defend some of the games provided as classic arcade style games, but wading through to find them was annoying. It was a rollercoaster for this review when i found Free Cell, and it operated like the Windows 3.1 version! This is a Buyer Be Warned situation for me.
